distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for pcre is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Low. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
PCRE is a Perl-compatible regular expression library. 

Security Fix(es):

* pcre: Buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled and \X or \R has fixed quantifier greater than 1 (CVE-2019-20838)

* pcre: Integer overflow when parsing callout numeric arguments (CVE-2020-14155)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.5 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: libpcre in PCRE before 8.43 allows a subject buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled, and \X or \R has more than one fixed quantifier, a related issue to CVE-2019-20454.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2019-20838 pcre: Buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled and \X or \R has fixed quantifier greater than 1
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Do not use more than one fixed quantifier with \R or \X with UTF disabled in PCRE or PCRE2, as these are the conditions needed to trigger the flaw.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-20838 pcre: Buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled and \X or \R has fixed quantifier greater than 1

notes.text: libpcre in PCRE before 8.44 allows an integer overflow via a large number after a (?C substring.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2020-14155 pcre: Integer overflow when parsing callout numeric arguments
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
This flaw can be mitigated by not compiling regular expressions with a callout value greater outside of 0-255 or handling the value passed to the callback within the application code.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-14155 pcre: Integer overflow when parsing callout numeric arguments
